ARABIC: وَمَآ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا وَلَهَا كِتَابٌ مَّعْلُومٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: We did not destroy any city without it having a set time.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Not one habitation have We destroyed but at the time determined for it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Whenever We destroyed a town, a definite term had previously been decreed for it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We never destroyed any town without pre-ordaining the fate of its people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And every dwelling that We destroyed, had a known decree for it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And never did We destroy a township but there was a known decree for it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And never did We destroy a town but it had a term made known.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Never a city have We destroyed, but it had a known decree,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And We destroyed no township but there was a known decree for it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: We have never destroyed a township without a definite decree having been issued;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And We have not destroyed a town but there was therefor a decree known.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: We did not destroy any town but that it had a known term.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Never did We destroy a population that had not a term decreed and assigned beforehand.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And never did We destroy a township but there was a known decree for it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: We never destroyed a village whose term had not already been decreed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: We have never destroyed a town unless it had a set time.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And We did not destroy any city but that for it was a known decree.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [15:4] And We did not destroy any town (min qaryatin: min is extra), meaning, its inhabitants, but that it had a known decree, a [pre-]determined term, after which it would be destroyed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And We destroyed no township) We destroyed no people of a township (but there was a known decree for it) except that there is an appointed term for their destruction.
